content.description:
Crux:  After doing the dynamic move to the jug rail, there is a tree growing on the right side of this ledge.  Heel hook right and reach up to a bad crimp with your right hand (although I have seen it done with the left).  Slowly lock off and reach a decent set of crimps 15ft up.  The crux is over, but the commitment is not.

New beta has been found that uses a mono after doing the first big move eliminating the original sequence described above.  Hence, the downgrade.
content.location: Center Line on the north face.

content.description: Start on two underclings and do the crux move to a decent slot.  Easier after that
content.location: On the same boulder as The Wind Below.  When facing the Wind Below go left and it is around the corner, the only line currently over there.

content.description: Start sitting, matched in a large jug rail. Sidepull jug in the middle of the face, reach for slopers at the lip and an exciting top out.
content.location: This problem is on the north side of the trail in between Trent's Mom boulder, and Wind From Below boulder. The problem faces the trail/road and is visible from the parking lot by worst case scenario. There is potential for more problems on this boulder
